classifications.consequences_if_untreated: If osteoarthritis is not treated, the condition will progressively worsen over months to years. The cartilage in the affected joints will continue to degenerate, leading to increased bone-on-bone friction. This results in chronic and often severe joint pain, stiffness, swelling, and tenderness. The range of motion in the affected joint will progressively decrease, leading to significant functional disability and difficulty performing daily activities such as walking, climbing stairs, dressing, or gripping objects. Muscle weakness and atrophy around the joint can occur due to disuse and pain. Joint deformities may develop, further impairing function. The chronic pain and disability can lead to a reduced quality of life, psychological distress (e.g., depression, anxiety), and social isolation. Reduced physical activity due to pain and limited mobility can also indirectly contribute to the development or worsening of other chronic conditions like obesity, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes, and increase the risk of falls.
classifications.severity: Reduced quality of life but no significant mortality risk
specific_outcomes: Indirect contribution to other chronic diseases (e.g., cardiovascular disease, obesity) due to inactivity

classifications.consequences_if_untreated: Severely elevated blood pressure (hypertensive crisis, specifically a hypertensive emergency) can lead to acute, life-threatening organ damage within hours or days. This includes conditions such as hypertensive encephalopathy, acute stroke (ischemic or hemorrhagic), acute myocardial infarction, acute heart failure with pulmonary edema, aortic dissection, and acute kidney injury. These conditions require immediate medical intervention to prevent death or permanent disability.
specific_outcomes: Acute heart failure with pulmonary edema

classifications.consequences_if_untreated: Sustained, untreated hypertension causes progressive damage to blood vessels and organs throughout the body over months to years. This leads to a significantly increased risk of major cardiovascular events, chronic kidney disease, and other systemic complications. The cumulative damage from high blood pressure is a leading cause of premature death and disability worldwide.
specific_outcomes: Chronic kidney disease leading to end-stage renal disease
